duties_responsibilities.duty: Accurately document current and future state network architecture changes in collaboration with the ITD Technicians.
Create and templatize network architecture artifacts based on DoD and Federal Architecture frameworks and standards.
Partner with key stakeholders and technical experts to perform legacy environment discovery and design new SD-WAN architecture patterns.
Document secure wide area connectivity inclusive of underlay, overlay, and COI transport design to support performance, quality of service, security, and mission requirements.
Provide secure access solutions leveraging wired and wireless technologies, integrating standards, use cases/scenarios, and developing associated implementation and transition plans.
Integrate capacity planning and scaling of network and security stack environments into the overall design of solutions.
Collect, investigate, and identify network optimization strategies and techniques to meet capacity and performance standards.
Identify legacy service paths and develop strategies and designs for enterprise service capability to meet requirements while balancing security, sustainability, and maintainability.
Support development of IP addressing schemes across IPv4 and IPv6 networks.
Ensure compliance to DoD standards to assist with providing accreditation artifacts in collaboration with information assurance teams.
Oversee and manage inventory and asset management support for ITD's network areas, ensuring all assets are accurately accounted for.
Create and deliver validated asset inventory reports by site to ITD monthly as part of the Project Status Reviews.
Update and provide network architecture diagrams encompassing WAN Transport, Security, Tactical, Comm System, and Local Area Transport data.
Ensure all reports and diagrams are readily available in Visio and PDF formats for ITD’s review and reference during the monthly Project Status Reviews.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree with 8+ years' experience or Master's degree with 6+ years of experience. Active DoD IAT Level I (i.e. Security+) certification or equivalent. Certified Cisco Network Professional (CCNP) or equivalent. Top Secret security clearance, with the ability to obtain 'Sensitive Compartmented Information' within DARPA.
